author: Megumi Fujikawa
title: Japan Central Bank Chief Looks to Fend Off Critics in New Term
text:
TOKYO—Haruhiko Kuroda, confirmed Friday for a new five-year term as Bank of Japan governor, faces pressure to end his experiment with radical monetary easing even though he says the nation isn’t ready yet.
The Japanese economy today has changed considerably since Mr. Kuroda took over the central bank five years ago as the central player in Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s revival plan. Growth has continued for the past eight quarters, the longest streak in 28 years; the Nikkei Stock Average has risen more than 70% during Mr. Kuroda’s... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
